Comoros - Macro-Economic Reform Capacity

Comoros - Macro-Economic Reform

repnme.cdata!:
Comoros - Macro Economic Reform and
            Capacity Building Credit Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Macro-Economic
            Reform and Capacity Building Credit Project to lay the
            foundation for economic growth by improving the enabling
            environment for private sector activity, while streamlining
            the public sector and restoring financial stability to the
            country. This operation is built on policies described in
            the first Policy Framework Paper (PFP) for 1991-1993 and is
            designed to address the most urgent issues facing Comoros --
            a small Franc-zone country with a weak administration and
            limited growth potential. Specifically, the operation will
            support policy measures to: (a) streamline the civil
            service; (b) withdraw the state from productive and
            commercial activities, and rationalize the remaining public
            enterprises; (c) establish a process of public expenditure
            programming and ensure a "safety net" of social
            expenditure; (d) improve the incentives framework for
            private investment; and (e) develop local institutional
            capacity in economic management.
